Background

I am currently using Michael Hatl's Learn Enough to Be Dangerous Ruby on Rails Tutorial along with his other tutorials. They're not free and are probably a little advanced for me but find them very informative with a lot of hands on learning.

Most recent post

Treehouse and Learn Enough to be Dangerous

by: - February 13, 2020

I am going back and forth between the Learn Enough to be Dangerous website and the Treehouse website.

THE FOUNDATION

HTML, CSS, JavaScript and (for me) Ruby!

RUBY / JavaScript

I Started learning Ruby via a free bootcamp with App Academy. It definitely pique my interest in programming.

HTML

After starting with Ruby, I realized the importance of HTML and CSS. I have been using Learn Enough to be Dangerous along with Treehouse. Treehouse does cost money but is free through my local public library.

I always recommend checking with your local public library's website to see what they offer before paying for anything.

CSS

CSS can be very confusing and complex. I've used Learn Enough to be Dangerous along with Treehouse.
